src.data_manipulation.imputation_strategies package

Submodules

src.data_manipulation.imputation_strategies.avgValue module

src.data_manipulation.imputation_strategies.avgValue.calculateVelocity(pi: float | floating, pf: float | floating, dtime: float | floating) → float[source]

Calculates the velocity between two points.

Parameters:

pifloat or np.floating

The initial position of the entity.

pffloat or np.floating

The final position of the entity.

dtimefloat or np.floating

The time difference between the initial and final positions.

Returns:

float

The calculated velocity.

src.data_manipulation.imputation_strategies.avgValue.impute(data: DataFrame = None, function: str = 'avgValue') → DataFrame[source]

Imputes missing or invalid data points in a DataFrame by filling in values based on average velocity.

Parameters:

datapd.DataFrame, optional

A DataFrame with ‘time’, ‘X’, and ‘Y’ columns. Missing data points in the ‘X’ and ‘Y’ columns will be filled in.

functionstr, optional

Function to determine how to fill in the missing data. Default is ‘avgValue’.

Returns:

pd.DataFrame

The DataFrame with missing or invalid data points imputed.
